page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: Many of the villagers have their own transport but public transport is still available in the village though this is fairly infrequent. The main bus companies that operate are Trimdon Motor Services and United. These buses call at the village as part of their main Bishop Auckland to Stockton, Hartlepool, and Durham routes. There are only two bus stops in the village. The children who come to school from the villages of Bradbury and Mordon travel on a private contract bus service run by Martindale's, a Ferryhill company. Children travelling to the Comprehensive school from the village do so with 'Scarlet Band'another private company on contract to the Education Authority.
